item.title: Great Shield of the Defender
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Define better. And also explain why meta is inferior. :P The only thing I can think of is the lack of plug-ins, although I have yet to look for a Japanese modeling site, which would probably have tons of meta plug-ins.

Toooo many spikes imo. And that grey texture just looks a bit odd. The wood one is okay, but not my favorite. I like the gash though. Next time you should look for like a fissure-like look…

Like that. Or maybe more like scratches like from swipes with a sword and some deeper notches from an axe. Just ideas. Glad at least someone has put my UV mapping tut to good use.

Waita go and make things complicated! gawwwsshhhh…

Read full topic

item.title: Great Shield of the Defender
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:5, topic:421716”]I’ve been using meta for aslong as i’ve started modelling, and im sticking with it. Also they are part of the texture.

Rename it;o? sounds so cheeseey weeseeey;o.

Good work though(i know nothing about models;o)

This was made to go with an axe i made, also called “Great axe of the…”. That is why i named it that.[/quote]
Ah, fair enough

Read full topic

item.title: Great Shield of the Defender
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“ravens, post:3, topic:421716”]is that in meta? if your not using it for RSPS might as well use a better modeling program
also are the cracks part of the texture, or part of the wireframe?[/quote]
Define better. And also explain why meta is inferior. The only thing I can think of is the lack of plug-ins, although I have yet to look for a Japanese modeling site, which would probably have tons of meta plug-ins.

Toooo many spikes imo. And that grey texture just looks a bit odd. The wood one is okay, but not my favorite. I like the gash though. Next time you should look for like a fissure-like look…

Like that. Or maybe more like scratches like from swipes with a sword and some deeper notches from an axe. Just ideas. Glad at least someone has put my UV mapping tut to good use.

Read full topic

item.title: Great Shield of the Defender
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote=“ravens, post:3, topic:421716”]is that in meta? if your not using it for RSPS might as well use a better modeling program
also are the cracks part of the texture, or part of the wireframe?[/quote]
I’ve been using meta for aslong as i’ve started modelling, and im sticking with it. Also they are part of the texture.

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:4, topic:421716”]Rename it;o? sounds so cheeseey weeseeey;o.

Good work though(i know nothing about models;o) :)[/quote]
This was made to go with an axe i made, also called “Great axe of the…”. That is why i named it that.

Read full topic
